title: [Feature Enhancement] - Multi SSH - paste multiple lines or commands
author: Hyper64
body_snippet:
## Expected Behavior
Copy multiple lines of text to the clipboard and paste them into Multi SSH to be sent to all selected SSH sessions at once.

## Current Behavior
Currently, no matter how many lines of configuration file you copy to the clipboard only one line is executed.  

Multi SSH command buffer limits input to one line of configuration or command at a time 

## Possible Solution
Implement a feature similar to Tera Term's Clipboard Confirmation window.  You can copy multiple lin...

iterations.description: Current Multi SSH toolbar is single-line and does not handle multi-line pastes; adding this capability allows users to execute script snippets across multiple sessions efficiently.

notes:
AI triage (gemini): Current Multi SSH toolbar is single-line and does not handle multi-line pastes; adding this capability allows users to execute script snippets across multiple sessions efficiently.
Approach: Modify `MultiSshToolStrip.cs` to intercept the `Ctrl+V` (Paste) event in `ProcessKeyPress`. Check if the clipboard contains text with newlines. If so, split the text by newlines and iterate through the lines, sending each line's characters followed by an Enter key command (`NativeMethods.WM_KEYDOWN`, 13) to all active connections via `SendAllKeystrokes`.
